name.description: Name of the person submitting the form.

SiteSettings.title: SiteSettings
SiteSettings.description: Stores global visibility settings for website sections.

showServices.description: Controls visibility of the services overview section.

showFunnel.description: Controls visibility of the funnel/process section.

Section.title: Section
Section.description: Represents a dynamic content section on the website.

ThemeSettings.title: ThemeSettings
ThemeSettings.description: Stores global theme settings for the website.

logoUrl.description: URL of the site logo for light mode.

logoUrlDark.description: URL of the site logo for dark mode.

useDarkLogo.description: Flag to enable the dark mode logo.

primaryColor.description: Primary theme color in HSL format (e.g., '0 84.2% 60.2%').

backgroundColor.description: Background theme color in HSL format (e.g., '0 0% 100%').

LandingPage.title: LandingPage
LandingPage.description: Represents a single, standalone landing page with its own dynamic content.

slug.description: The URL-friendly identifier for the page (e.g., 'special-offer').

content.description: An array of content sections, similar to the main homepage sections.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the page was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the page was last updated.

CodedLandingPage.title: CodedLandingPage
CodedLandingPage.description: Represents a manually coded landing page with editable metadata.

slug.description: The URL-friendly identifier for the page (e.g., 'coded-offer').

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the page was created.

PersonalBrandingPage.title: PersonalBrandingPage
PersonalBrandingPage.description: Content for the Personal Branding landing page.

logoSize.description: Size of the logo in pixels.

Testimonial.title: Testimonial
Testimonial.description: Represents a client testimonial or review.

name.description: Name of the client giving the review.

avatarUrl.description: URL of the client's avatar image.

review.description: The text content of the review.

source.description: The platform where the review originated, e.g., 'Google'.

position.description: Position or title of the client, e.g., 'CEO'.

TeamMember.title: TeamMember
TeamMember.description: Represents a member of the team.

imageUrl.description: URL of the team member's photo.

order.description: The display order of the member.

title.description: The main title of the blog post.

slug.description: The URL-friendly identifier for the post.

excerpt.description: A short summary of the post for display in lists.

imageUrl.description: URL of the post's main image.

content.description: An array of content sections, similar to landing pages.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the post was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the post was last updated.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to accommodate the entities and features described in the request, focusing on simplicity, security, and scalability. The structure leverages structural segregation, path-based ownership and denormalization to ensure authorization independence and efficient data retrieval. It's crucial to note that given the information available from the request, the data structure is designed to accommodate the described UI elements.

1.  **Clients**: Stored in a root-level `clients` collection. This allows for easy listing and management of clients. Security rules would typically restrict write access to authorized admin users.
2.  **Services**: Similar to clients, services are stored in a root-level `services` collection for straightforward access and management. Admin roles would govern write access. The service entity now includes both `iconName` for library icons and `iconUrl` for custom uploads, both are optional to provide flexibility.
3.  **Funnel Steps**: Funnel steps, like services and clients, are stored in the root-level `funnel_steps` collection. Admin roles would govern write access.
4.  **Contact Form Submissions**: All contact form submissions are stored in a root-level `contact_form_submissions` collection. Because these are unauthenticated submissions, security rules will ensure only write operations are permitted, limiting the risk of data injection or manipulation. A server-side function could process these submissions further.
5.  **Site Settings**: A `site_settings` collection holds global configuration, such as section visibility and now hero section content. This is designed to hold a single document for easy access to global state. It will be publicly readable but only writable by admins.
6. **Sections**: A new `sections` collection stores dynamic content blocks for the homepage. This allows an administrator to add, remove, and reorder content sections like feature grids, CTAs, etc., without needing to deploy new code. Publicly readable, admin write access.
7. **Theme Settings**: A new `theme_settings` collection holds global theme configuration, such as logo URL and colors. This is designed to hold a single document for easy access to the site's visual theme. It will be publicly readable but only writable by admins.
8. **Landing Pages**: A new `landing_pages` collection will store individual, dynamic landing pages. Each document will contain the page's title, slug (for URL), and its own content structure. This makes pages publicly readable but only manageable by admins.
9. **Testimonials**: A new `testimonials` collection to store client reviews. This allows easy management of testimonials separately from other content, and they can be queried efficiently for display on the front-end. Publicly readable, admin write.
10. **Team Members**: A new `team_members` collection stores information about team members. This allows for easy management of the team section on the website. Publicly readable, admin write.
11. **Blog Posts**: A new `blog_posts` collection stores blog articles. This structure mirrors landing pages, allowing for dynamic content creation for each post. It's publicly readable and admin-writable.
